results.title: A case with familial hypercholesterolemia complicated with severe systemic atherosclerosis intensively treated for more than 30 years.
results.text_hl: A 47-year-old female was referred to our hospital due to her @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014973 @@@systemic xanthomatosis@@@ associated with elevated LDL-cholesterolemia (292 mg/dl).

results.title: Similar response to simvastatin in patients heterozygous for familial hypercholesterolemia with mRNA negative and mRNA positive mutations.
results.text_hl: Out of 116 consecutive, unrelated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hyperlipoproteinemia_Type_II @DISEASE_MESH:D006938 @@@familial hypercholesterolemia@@@, 27 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were selected for molecular analyses: 14 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mRNA negative and 13 with mRNA positive mutations. Before @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment, @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mRNA negative mutations had higher levels of LDL cholesterol, lower levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol and significantly more often @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014973 @@@tendon xanthomas@@@, compared to @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mRNA positive mutations.

citations.NLM: Sijbrands EJ, Lombardi MP, Westendorp RG, Leuven JA, Meinders AE, Van der Laarse A, Frants RR, Havekes LM, Smelt AH. Similar response to simvastatin in patients heterozygous for familial hypercholesterolemia with mRNA negative and mRNA positive mutations. Atherosclerosis. 1998 Feb;136(2):247-54. PMID: 9543095
citations.BibTeX: @article{9543095, title={Similar response to simvastatin in patients heterozygous for familial hypercholesterolemia with mRNA negative and mRNA positive mutations.}, author={Sijbrands EJ and Lombardi MP and Westendorp RG and Leuven JA and Meinders AE and Van der Laarse A and Frants RR and Havekes LM and Smelt AH}, journal={Atherosclerosis}, volume={136}, number={2}, pages={247-54}}

results.title: Immunohistochemical distribution of lipoprotein epitopes in xanthomata from patients with familial hypercholesterolemia.
results.text_hl: The observed epitope distribution of LDL, OxLDL, or @GENE_LPA @GENE_4018 @@@apo(a)@@@ was the same regardless of the method of treatment of the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ from whom the @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014973 @@@xanthomas@@@ were obtained (@CHEMICAL_Probucol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011341 @@@probucol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, LDL apheresis).

citations.NLM: Sugiyama N, Marcovina S, Gown AM, Seftel H, Joffe B, Chait A. Immunohistochemical distribution of lipoprotein epitopes in xanthomata from patients with familial hypercholesterolemia. Am J Pathol. 1992 Jul;141(1):99-106. PMID: 1378698

results.title: [Skin manifestation of mixed hyperlipidaemia in the course of decompensated diabetes].
results.text_hl: During the treatment the infusion liquids, @CHEMICAL_Insulin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007328 @@@insulin@@@, metronidasol, amoxiclav, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ were administered.

results.title: [Three-year-old boy--a homozygote for familiar hypercholesterolemia].
results.text_hl: The boy has been treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, but without reaching the treatment goals.

results.title: Homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia with generalized arterial disease.
results.text_hl: On examination, he was found to have multiple planar @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014973 @@@and tendinous xanthomas@@@, an (LDL) cholesterol level of 24.6 mmol/l and family history of @DISEASE_Hypercholesterolemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006937 @@@hypercholesterolemia@@@.

results.title: Compound heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia in a Chinese boy with a de novo and transmitted low-density lipoprotein receptor mutation.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The proband displayed extensive @<m>DISEASE_Xanthomatosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D014973 @@@cutaneous and tendon xanthomas@@@ together with elevated serum LDL-C level of 14.87 mmol/L (575 mg/dL).

citations.NLM: Ma Y, Gong Y, Garg A, Zhou H. Compound heterozygous familial hypercholesterolemia in a Chinese boy with a de novo and transmitted low-density lipoprotein receptor mutation. J Clin Lipidol. 2018 Jan-Feb;12(1):230-235.e6. PMID: 29233637
